graphs
Class Graph

java.lang.Object
  graphs.Graph

public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object

A Graph is a set of Nodes, grouped in (overlapped) Clusters, that are classified in ResultSets. The nodes of each Cluster are joined by Edges. Graph controls the structure of nodes and edges BiclusVis controls the layout, interaction and manages the drawing

Author:
Roberto Therón and Rodrigo Santamaría

 double getFailedPositionMetric()
          Returns the value of a homemade measure to determine the degree of mispositioning of nodes The formula is: (nº of nodes placed upon a hull it is not in)/(nº of nodes) It will change with time to more sophisticated one Now it is (nº of times a node sits on a non-corresponding hull)/(nº of possible missittings) The nº of possible missitting is sum(numClusters-numClustersInWhichNodeKis)

addCenterNode

public void addCenterNode(Node n)
Add a center node to the Graph. A center node is a dummy node, that can be used as centroid for a group. Center nodes are not drawn, its purpose is to make underlying connections inside clusters.

Parameters:
n - Cented node added

addClusterSet

public void addClusterSet(ClusterSet r)
Adds a ClusterSet to the graph DEPLOYMENT NOTE: still this not adds all nodes in the ClusterSet to the Graph, it must be done by addNode()

Parameters:
r - ClusterSet to add to the graph

draw

public void draw(int[] priorities)
Draws the graph by layers. The position of each component in the list priorities sets its drawing order. Por example, if priorities is {HULL, NODE, LABEL}, first hulls are drawn, then overlapping nodes and finally labels. If any element is not present in the vector, it will not be drawn. Elements to draw are HULL, NODE, HULLLABEL, NODELABEL, EDGE, DETAIL, PIECHART,HOVER, SELECT and SEARCH

Parameters:
priorities - the elements to be drawn, ordered so the first element in the list will be the first element drawn

drawComponent

public void drawComponent(int component)
Draws one of the component of the graphs, as explained in draw(int[] priorities)

Parameters:
component - component of the graph

drawEdges

public void drawEdges()
Draws the edges in the graph

draw

public void draw()
Draws all the components in the graph at a predefined order

drawHoverNode

public void drawHoverNode()
Draws the Hover node, highlighted, and also highlights their neighbors (all the nodes directly connected to it)

drawSelectedNodes

public void drawSelectedNodes()
Draws node selected. Selected nodes also show their labels, on a different color

drawSearchedNodes

public void drawSearchedNodes()
Draw searched Nodes. Searched nodes are surrounded by a circle

drawFull

public void drawFull()
Draws the complete Graph, with all their compounds, at a specified order

public void drawNodes()
Draw the nodes in the Graph

pointInScreen

public boolean pointInScreen(GraphPoint2D point)
Returns true if point is in the visible area (the area in which we are navigating now)

Parameters:
point - point to check if is in the area
Returns:
true if point is in the visible area

radial2complete

public void radial2complete()
Converts the Clusters in the Graph to maximal complete subgraphs

complete2radial

public void complete2radial()
Converts the clusters in the graph to radial subgraphs, adding a center node

getFailedPositionMetric

public double getFailedPositionMetric()
Returns the value of a homemade measure to determine the degree of mispositioning of nodes The formula is: (nº of nodes placed upon a hull it is not in)/(nº of nodes) It will change with time to more sophisticated one Now it is (nº of times a node sits on a non-corresponding hull)/(nº of possible missittings) The nº of possible missitting is sum(numClusters-numClustersInWhichNodeKis)

getAverageNormArea

public double getAverageNormArea()
Returns the average area of the hull respect to the number of nodes contained It uses bounding boxes to compute hull's area instead of real area. Other option is to do triangulations

getApplet

public BiclusVis getApplet()
Returns the applet in which this Graph is drawn

Returns:
the applet in which this Graph is to be visualized and managed
